Backend

Class UserAuth

  • java.lang.Object
    • Backend.UserAuth

  • public class UserAuth
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides login credential services. It contains static methods which perform login functions.

    • Constructor Summary

      UserAuth()

      static boolean isRegistered(java.lang.String username)
      This static method will compare the username input with all the User objects in the database in order to find a match.
      static User isValidInput(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      This static method will compare the user credentials passed into this method against that in the database.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserAuth

        public UserAuth()

    • Method Detail

      • isValidInput

        public static User isValidInput(java.lang.String username,
                java.lang.String password)
        This static method will compare the user credentials passed into this method against that in the database. It will attempt to find a User with a matching username and, if successful, will identify if the password in the database matches that which is input. It will return the instance of the user in the database.

        This method does not guarantee results if the user does not exist in the database. That functionality is handled by the method isRegistered(). This method also does not guarantee results if more than one user share the same username.

        Parameters:
        username - A String object containing the username
        password - A String object containing the password
        Returns:
        Returns a User object if the input of username and password matches the credentials of that user in the database. Otherwise null is returned.

      • isRegistered

        public static boolean isRegistered(java.lang.String username)
        This static method will compare the username input with all the User objects in the database in order to find a match. If a user with the matching username is found, the method return true.

        This method assumes the unique identifier to every user is the username. It will not guarantee results if more than one user share an identical username.

        Parameters:
        username - A string object containing the username
        Returns:
        A boolean variable which is true if the username exists in the database. Otherwise false.
